sub_title: Communications Officer at University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR)
summary:
Communicating science, social developments & impact, to an internal audience of researchers as well as to a broader public through online and offline communication and events. 

Strategic development, creative thinking, human interest, storytelling, knowledge exchange, project and financial management, web writing, communication tools, connector.

projects.title: Small Victims, Large Numbers
projects.description:
'Small Victims, Large Numbers' is an art installation, which was exposed in front of the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam in June, 2016. 

Again, in the official 'Week against Child Abuse' - from 14 till 20 November, 2016, the installation will be adopted by multiple Dutch municipalities (Eindhoven, Rotterdam, Haarlemmermeer) in respect to the weekly (!) child victims, that die because of domestic violence in the Netherlands.

contributors.headline: Communications Officer at University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR)

projects.title: Fight4YourRights!
projects.description:
Fight4YourRights is a creative action for children's rights on Universal Children's Day, 20 November. Together with the Amsterdam Public Library (OBA), Science Centre NEMO, the Dutch Foundation for Disabled Children (NSGK), radio station AmsterdamFM, Amnesty International and several elementary schools, Power of Art House spoke out about the importance of children's rights. 

Ahead of November 20, life-size art street art visuals appeared on the premises of above organizations. A creative statement from Power of Art House, to make the public - and especially  children - aware of these rights and encourage them for fight for them. Next to that, we organised a special Child's Rights debate in the Public Library of Amsterdam, in collaboration with Amnesty International, that was live broadcasted on AmsterdamFM radio.

contributors.headline: Communications Officer at University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR)

projects.title: Moving People
projects.description:
Street art project 'Moving People' features thousands of miniature figures modelled on 10 people and their real-life stories of how they were forced to flee their countries. 

In September 201, we launched Moving People: 10.010 mini-refugees appeared all over Amsterdam and The Hague. On park benches, at stations, at traffic lights, along the canals, in the zoo, in front of various ministries....they popped up everywhere! They even appeared in other cities and countries like the Unites States, Italy, Spain, Germany, Great Britain and China. And they still are! Check out: www.movingpeople.nu/social

The ten miniatures represent real people and their moving stories. Small but tangible stories of human voices behind the endless numbers of refugees in the news headlines. These are stories that need to be told, with an artistic - but non-political - twist. The small figures are meant to move, to literally travel through the city. We show the human stories behind the overwhelming news footage and so-called 'swarms of refugees.'

Moving People is a street art project in which everybody can show commitment to refugees and let their voice be heard in a creative way. If you do happen to find a one of the miniatures, you can take it with you and place it somewhere else. In this way you can contribute physically to the project by moving the miniatures around the city, country, or even the world. Move and be moved. 

More info: www.movingpeople.nu

contributors.headline: Communications Officer at University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR)

projects.title: Lowlands University
projects.description:
The professor as a popstar! Lowlands University was an annual series of scientific lectures, given at the biggest pop festival of the Netherlands: Lowlands Festival. Coolpolitics organized Lowlands University for 10 years (2005 - 2014) in cooperation with Mojo Concerts, to inspire young people and make them see the importance of science and knowledge for society. 

Among the speakers were renown scientists such as Nobel Prize winner Gerard ‘t Hooft, Spinoza award winners Peter Hagoort and Robbert Dijkgraaf, and other eloquent speakers such as Ruud Lubbers, Ronald Plasterk, Michael Braungart, Wubbo Ockels, Pieter van Vollenhoven, Jan Pronk, Herman Wijffels, Leo Kouwenhoven and former European Commissioner Frits Bolkestein. 

From the start in 2005, the lectures were a huge success. The tent that hosted Lowlands University was filled completely for just about every lecture, some 1.000 seats per lecture. The media have paid elaborate attention to the lectures and – most importantly - the project was highly appreciated by the Lowlands festival audience.

contributors.headline: Communications Officer at University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR)

projects.title: MTV Coolpolitics
projects.description: MTV Coolpolitics was a series of popular political television shows for MTV Netherlands, where controversial issues were discussed between artists, politicians and the (festival) audience. The shows were recorded at different locations such as pop festivals, and were edited into live programs for MTV Netherlands.

contributors.headline: Communications Officer at University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR)

projects.title: Kunstpiloten (Art Pilots)
projects.description:
In 2011 Coolpolitics produced Kunstpiloten (art pilots); a television series about the backstage of the Dutch world of arts for a young audience. Kunstpiloten took the viewers backstage to the arts in Amsterdam, The Hague, Utrecht and Rotterdam. Each episode of Kunstpiloten featured a particular arttheme, such as the world of art’s most powerful people, unusual collectors or the costs of public art. 

Presented by Dutch TV host Sol Wortelboer, Kunstpiloten was created for people who are into art and for people who just want to know where the money is made, who has the power, and who is exploring the horizon. Additionally, Coolpolitics created a Kunstpiloten curriculum for students in highschool.

contributors.headline: Communications Officer at University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR)

profile_positions.description:
As the person responsible for profiling, communication strategy, policy coordination and implementation at the Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (AISSR), my role involves a range of activities aimed at promoting the social relevance and impact of the institute's scientific work. 

I develop and implement strategies to showcase the expertise and research conducted by the over 400 scientists at the AISSR. This includes highlighting the key areas of research and the institute's contributions to urgent social and political issues such as migration, global health, environmental sustainability, urban quality-of-life, and global terrorism.

Overall, my goals revolve around making the AISSR's scientific work, expertise and social impact visible to diverse audiences, internally and externally. By actively promoting the research conducted at the AISSR in cooperation with our scientists, I aim to raise public awareness, and foster collaboration within and beyond our institute.
profile_positions.title: Communications Officer

profile_positions.description:
As a program manager, I advised and informed scientific staff, PhD candidates and (inter)national partners about procedural, facility, financial and policy matters. In this role, I was responsible for tackling all kinds of problems. I managed around 50 research projects and their budgets and assisted in the implementation and communication. Including staff employment, coordination of budgets, planning, financial and scientific reporting. All of this in constant consultation and cooperation with our (inter)national university partners and (public and private) funders, such as the European Commission, the Dutch Research Council (NWO), The Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW) and the Amsterdam City Council. 

Next to that, I monitored the PhD research projects of our inter(national) PhD candidates, as well as the so-called Joint Doctorate programs, in close cooperation with our international partner universities like Washington University in St. Louis (USA), the École des hautes études en sciences sociales (EHESS) in Paris, the University of Milan and the University of Brescia (Italy).
profile_positions.title: Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Power of Art House is an artistic think tank and creative collective of designers, socio-cultural entrepreneurs, producers and other creative thinkers, that commits creative interventions and campaigns to bring socio-cultural themes into the spotlight. 

As a Program Manager and producer at Power of Art House, I was responsible for the daily management, production and coordination of our creative programs, campaigns and interventions. From concept development to event production. From copywriting to monitoring and evaluation. And from grants and crowdfunding to (online) communication and PR.

In this role I was constantly identifying social and cultural developments and trends, and looking for opportunities in a broad cultural network to create new partnerships or strengthen existing collaborations. Such as: Pakhuis de Zwijger, The Public Prosecution Service (OM), Dutch Council for Refugees, Amsterdam Fund for the Arts, Twynstra Gudde, Movies that Matter, Amnesty International, Humanity House, Pantar, voordekunst, and different (national) and international authorities, universities and artists.

Although I am no longer working on a daily basis for Power of Art House, I am still a proud member of their think-tank, while aiming to develop new concepts for creative interventions.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Coolpolitics developed and organized programmes and educational projects around politics, culture, science, art and media. By developing innovative and accessible content on cultural and global (political) themes, we wanted to provide a platform to engage and stimulate citizenship. As a project manager at Coolpolitics, I was responsible for the development, progress and daily management of the concepts, programs and events, as well as:

- (Final) editing, copywriting, marketing-communication, press, social media and PR,
- Producing and directing public live events,
- Fundraising and budget management,
- Monitoring, evaluations, 
- Coordination external partnerships and relations.

Main programs, events and partners:

- Lowlands University; annual series of scientific lectures at Lowlands, the biggest Dutch pop festival.
- MTV Coolpolitics; series of (political) debates in cooperation with MTV Networks.
- Kunstpiloten; a television program for high school students about Dutch art.
- Coolpolitics Talks @ International Documentary Festival Amsterdam (IDFA),
- Masterclasses Human Rights and Global Journalism, for future journalists and storytellers.
- Art Intervention; masterclasses about social design (design, sustainability, social awareness). 
- Online youth campaigns together with diverse social networks.
- Various live events in collaboration with the European Commission, Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, Ministry of Social Affairs, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Amnesty International, Paradiso Amsterdam, Oxfam, the Red Cross and various universities, cultural and scientific institutions like The Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW) and The Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO).
profile_positions.title: Project Manager | Producer

profile_positions.description:
Lokaalmondiaal produced documentaries and television programs about developing countries, published magazines and books and organized global journalistic exchanges. 

As a project manager at Lokaalmondiaal I initiated, organized and coordinated several (international) conferences, masterclasses, symposia, debates and book launches about global journalism, storytelling and international development. Together with renown journalists and main (NGO) partners like Oxfam Novib, Vice Versa, Dick Scherpenzeel Stichting, De Balie, NCDO, Humanity House and WO=MEN.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: At OSA (network of entrepreneurs in the Amsterdam social sector) I did qualitative research into apprenticeships for underprivileged youth, as part of a metropolitan coaching program. Furthermore I wrote the policy report for the internal communication within OSA.
profile_positions.title: Research / consulting

profile_positions.description: At art-education foundation Bekijk 't, I worked on their youth press department 'Deadline'. I was a producer of various special news series, I did the editorial supervision of young people and I worked on the editing and review articles. Furthermore, I wrote their two-year policy plan and recommendation for funding, fundraising and partnerships.
profile_positions.title: Producer, editor

profile_positions.description: In marketing agency MeerdanCommunicatie I worked as the right hand of the project leader and responsible for the production of live events and completions in the field of urban renewal.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Account Manager

profile_positions.description: Documenting and structuring the (offline) police database.
profile_positions.title: Database Administrator

volunteer_experiences.description: DOEN Foundation - as well as the VSBfund - funds, promotes and connects cultural organizations. I evaluated and reported a large number of their funded events and shows, based on the quality guidelines of both the foundations.

In my work as an assistant editor, I worked on the creation of a promotional magazine for the Amsterdam underground live (music) scene. Subsequently, I did PR work for nightclub Winston Kingdom in Amsterdam.
I am a juror during the preliminary rounds of the Dutch Debating Championship for Students (15-18)

Power of Art House is an artistic think tank and creative collective of designers, socio-cultural entrepreneurs, producers and other creative thinkers, that commits creative interventions and campaigns to bring socio-cultural themes into the spotlight. Their interventions and campaigns combat apathy and indifference in a creative way.
